page.title: 02EMPLOYMENT, CLIFTON HAMPDEN
page.content:
The vast majority of residents are employed in the area, although a number use Clifton Hampden, which is conveniently near Didcot British Rail station, for commuting to London.
Once farming employed much of the vilage population but now the JET project and the Culham Laboratories provide a large number of jobs such as cleaning for indigenous labour. Very few scientists live locally.
Many new families work slightly further afield in Oxford, especially at the University or the Cowley Works, although jobs are diverse and include the theatre.
